name: #Biodiversity
description: Use of practices to increase biodiversity, including attracting birds, butterflies, pollinators, water sources, logs or rocks, native plants, and limiting use of pesticides and herbicides.

name: #CommunityGarden
description: Support for community gardening.

name: #Compost
description: Use or storage of compost

name: #CompostTea
description: Use of vermiculture fluid byproducts for fertilization or pest control.

name: #CoverCrops
description: Crops grown to slow erosion, improve soil health, enhance water availability, smother weeds, help control pests and diseases, and/or increase biodiversity.

name: #DitchChemicals
description: Use of alternatives to chemicals for pest control or fertilization.

name: #DripIrrigation
description: Use of drip irrigation to reduce water use and evaporation.

name: #Habitat
description: Creation of habitat friendly to birds, butterflies, pollinators, and other wildlife

name: #Hugelculture
description: Use of hugelculture for composting.

name: #Hummingbirds
description: Practices to attract hummingbirds or pictures of them in the garden.

name: #LarvalHostPlants
description: Plants that can be used by caterpillars for growth and development.

name: #MasterGardenerAtWork
description: A master gardener volunteering to help others in some way.

name: #MasterGardenerCertificate
description: Verification of completion of a master gardener course.

name: #NativeBees
description: Appearance of native (as opposed to honey) bees. Native bees are more effective for pollination.

name: #NativePlants
description: Use of native plants that are adapted to local soil and climate and attract native butterflies, insects, birds, and other animals.

name: #PermacultureCertificate
description: Verification of completion of a permaculture workshop or course.

name: #PesticideFree
description: Use of alternatives to chemicals for pest control.

name: #PollinatorFriendly
description: Creation of foraging habitat, native plants that serve as sources of nectar, pollen for adult pollinators, and plants with flowers shapes that are accessible to pollinators.  Also, use of pesticides that are not harmful to pollinators.

name: #Rainwater
description: Use of rain water for irrigation.

name: #SaltLick
description: Use of a damp salt lick to attract butterflies and bees

name: #SchoolGarden
description: Support for a school garden.

name: #SeedSaving
description: Growth of plants to harvest seeds for future planting.

name: #SeedSharing
description: Sharing home-grown seeds with others.

name: #SheetMulch
description: Use of plastic sheets for mulching.

name: #Vermiculture
description: Cultivation of worms to convert organic waste into nutrient-rich compost.

name: #WaterTimer
description: Use of a timer to use water more efficiently.

name: #Worms
description: Use worms for vermiculture or presence of worms in the garden.
